page.title: 14GOAT-KEEPING DRINKSTONE
page.content: We keep goats. We have two British Alpines named Rosie and Kitty. They are black and white. Every year they have kids. The father is Anglo-Nubian. He is brown with a black stripe. This year we had four kids. Two had colours like the father, and two like the mothers. There is an electric fence around the goats' grazing area. It works by a big battery which costs Â£12. The goats eat grass, oats, maize, dried peas, sugar-beet and hay. My Mum milks them in the morning and I help her. We strain the milk, then cool it. We have some for breakfast, and sell some. We have goats because my brother is allergic to cows' milk. It gives him eczema. The kids are used for meat. We put them in the freezer.
